name: Science Fiction
description: Explores speculative concepts, advanced technology, and the impact of science on society, often set in the future or alternate realities.

name: Fantasy
description: Features magical elements, mythical creatures, and often takes place in imagined worlds, focusing on epic journeys, good versus evil, or personal quests.

name: Mystery
description: Centers on a crime or puzzle that a protagonist must solve through investigation, clues, and deduction, typically leading to a surprising reveal.

name: Thriller
description: A fast-paced genre designed to elicit excitement, suspense, and anticipation in the reader, often involving high stakes, a menacing antagonist, and a race against time.

name: Romance
description: Focuses on the development of a romantic relationship between two or more characters, culminating in an emotionally satisfying and optimistic ending.

name: Horror
description: Aims to evoke fear, dread, and revulsion in the reader through supernatural elements, psychological terror, or graphic violence, exploring the darker aspects of human nature or the unknown.

name: Historical Fiction
description: Set in a recognizable past period, it weaves fictional characters and plots into historically accurate settings and events, bringing a bygone era to life.

name: Young Adult
description: Features protagonists typically between the ages of 12 and 18, addressing themes of identity, coming-of-age, friendship, and first love.

name: Dystopian
description: Explores a fictional society that is undesirable or frightening, often as a critique of current societal trends or political systems, highlighting oppression and rebellion.

name: Action/Adventure
description: Revolves around a protagonist who embarks on a perilous journey or quest, facing danger, challenges, and exciting events in dynamic settings.

name: Western
description: Set in the American Old West, this genre often features cowboys, outlaws, and lawmen, exploring themes of frontier life, justice, and survival.

name: Crime Fiction
description: Focuses on criminal acts and their consequences, often from the perspective of law enforcement, criminals, or victims, exploring the motivations and impact of illegal activities.

name: Literary Fiction
description: Characterized by its focus on style, character development, and thematic depth, often exploring complex human experiences and societal issues.

name: Gothic Fiction
description: Blends elements of horror and romance, often set in dark, atmospheric locations, emphasizing suspense, mystery, and the supernatural.

name: Comedy
description: Aims to amuse and entertain through humorous situations, characters, and dialogue, often leading to a lighthearted or joyful resolution.

name: Urban Fantasy
description: Blends fantastical elements with a contemporary, real-world urban setting, often featuring magic, mythical creatures, or supernatural beings hidden among humanity.

name: Paranormal Romance
description: Centers on romantic relationships between human characters and supernatural beings, such as vampires, werewolves, or ghosts, often incorporating elements of fantasy or horror.

name: Steampunk
description: Features anachronistic technology inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery within a speculative, often Victorian-era, setting.

name: Cyberpunk
description: Set in a dystopian future, focusing on advanced technology like artificial intelligence and cybernetics, alongside societal breakdown and corporate control.

name: Magical Realism
description: Weaves fantastical or mythical elements into a realistic setting, treating the magical as mundane and seamlessly integrating it into everyday life.

name: Contemporary Romance
description: Explores romantic relationships set in the present day, focusing on modern challenges, emotional intimacy, and realistic character development.

name: Cozy Mystery
description: Features an amateur detective solving a crime, usually without graphic violence or explicit content, often set in a small, close-knit community.

name: Epic Fantasy
description: Involves large-scale conflicts, intricate world-building, and numerous characters often engaged in a struggle for the fate of an entire world or kingdom.

name: Space Opera
description: Features adventurous, often melodramatic, stories set in outer space, typically involving advanced technology, futuristic warfare, and exploration of distant galaxies.

name: Speculative Fiction
description: An umbrella term for genres that explore worlds different from our own, encompassing science fiction, fantasy, horror, and their subgenres.

name: Legal Thriller
description: Focuses on legal proceedings, lawyers, and courtroom drama, often involving high-stakes cases, corruption, and moral dilemmas.

name: Medical Thriller
description: Centers on medical professionals, diseases, biohazards, and ethical issues within the healthcare industry, often with a suspenseful plot.

name: Psychological Thriller
description: Emphasizes the unstable or delusional psychological states of its characters, creating suspense through internal conflict and unreliable narration rather than external action.

name: Espionage Thriller
description: Involves spies, secret agents, and international intrigue, often featuring political conspiracies, covert operations, and double-crosses.

name: Dark Fantasy
description: Blends fantasy elements with tones and themes from horror, often featuring morally ambiguous characters and a bleaker, more cynical world view.

name: Historical Romance
description: Combines elements of romance with a historical setting, often focusing on courtly love, societal expectations, and the challenges of relationships in a specific past era.

name: Military Science Fiction
description: Focuses on warfare in outer space or on other planets, often exploring military tactics, technology, and the experiences of soldiers in a futuristic context.

name: Post-Apocalyptic
description: Set after a catastrophic event that has devastated civilization, exploring survival, rebuilding, and the human condition in a harsh new world.

name: Biographical Fiction
description: A fictionalized account of a real person's life, blending factual events with imaginative storytelling to explore their experiences and impact.

name: Satire
description: Uses humor, irony, exaggeration, or ridicule to expose and criticize people's stupidity or vices, particularly in the context of contemporary politics and other topical issues.

name: Social Science Fiction
description: Explores sociological concepts, human behavior, and societal structures within a futuristic or alternate reality setting, often posing 'what if' questions about humanity.

name: Techno-Thriller
description: Combines the suspense of a thriller with detailed technological explanations and cutting-edge science, often involving advanced weaponry, computer hacking, or scientific breakthroughs.

name: New Adult
description: Features protagonists typically aged 18-25, focusing on challenges of early adulthood, college life, career beginnings, and more mature romantic relationships.

name: Gothic Romance
description: A subgenre of Gothic fiction that emphasizes romantic elements within a dark, mysterious, and often supernatural setting, with strong emotional intensity.

name: Hard Science Fiction
description: Emphasizes scientific accuracy and plausibility, with technological and scientific details central to the plot and world-building.

name: Soft Science Fiction
description: Focuses on the social sciences (psychology, sociology, anthropology) rather than the natural sciences, exploring human nature and society in speculative settings.

name: Slipstream
description: A genre that blurs the boundaries between traditional genres, often incorporating elements of the fantastic or surreal into otherwise realistic narratives.

name: Bildungsroman
description: A coming-of-age story that tracks the moral and psychological growth of the protagonist from youth to adulthood, often through a series of formative experiences.

name: Pulp Fiction
description: Refers to mass-produced, inexpensive fiction popular in the early 20th century, characterized by sensational plots, vivid characters, and often genre-specific tropes.

name: Fantastique
description: A genre where the supernatural intrudes into a realistic world, creating doubt in the characters and reader about whether the events are real or imagined.

name: Paranormal
description: Focuses on phenomena that are outside the scope of normal scientific understanding, such as ghosts, psychics, or other supernatural occurrences.

name: Mythic Fiction
description: Draws heavily on mythology, folklore, and religious stories, reinterpreting or expanding upon these ancient narratives in new settings or with modern characters.

name: Urban Fiction (Street Lit)
description: A contemporary genre often set in an urban environment, focusing on issues of poverty, crime, and social struggles, typically from the perspective of marginalized communities.

name: Noir
description: A subgenre of crime fiction characterized by a cynical, morally ambiguous protagonist, bleak settings, and a sense of inevitable doom or fatalism.

name: Magical Girl
description: Features young female protagonists who possess magical abilities, typically used to fight evil or solve problems, often with a focus on friendship and personal growth.
